result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samuel D Barker in court.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Samuel D Barker. Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samuel D Barker in court.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Samuel D Barker. Dep C.R. sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA. Witness identified defn. Cross exam by Atty Anderson. Witness excused. State moved for bindover. Defn obj. Court found probable cause and ordered bindover.

2:27 PM Defendant Samuel D Barker in court.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Samuel D Barker.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

02:06 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
